subject: Olympic Games (2008)
Tennis
lead_paragraph: Nicolás Massú of Chile, who won gold medals in singles and doubles in tennis at the 2004 Olympics, was among 12 players given special places in singles at the 2008 Games in Beijing. The places are awarded by the International Tennis Federation to players who did not meet requirements for direct acceptance. Massú’s ranking of 131 was too low to qualify.
